subject: Home Again
event: Got back last night from Seattle. Norwescon was a lot of fun. I got to hang with some old friends and made some new ones, and drank far too many White Russians. (The Dude abides). My hosts treated me very well. I read the new 'Alayne' chapter, the one I just uploaded, and got a great response. I'm very pleased that so many of you liked it. (I've gotten some nice emails about it too. Sorry that I cannot reply, but there are just too many). The con also featured a Burlesque show with a GAME OF THRONES theme. That was fun too. The Philip K. Dick awards were given out. I haven't actually read any of the finalists, but a couple of the winners were present, and I was pleased to meet them. This year's Hugo ballot was also announced, simultaneously with similar announcements at Minicon and the British Eastercon. I am going to have more to say about that soon. A lot more. But not in this post. I don't want to spoil the mood here. Fandom Is (indeed) a Way of Life, and attending a con like Norwescon always feels like coming home. Oh, and once more, for all the Seahawks fans I met this weekend... THEY SHOULD HAVE GIVEN THE BALL TO BEAST MODE. Worst. Call. Ever.

comments.article: Ia divorcing common in Westeros?
comments.subject: ASOIAF question

comments.article: Pretty much unheard of.  But marriages can be annuled or set aside for a variety of reasons.
comments.subject: Re: ASOIAF question

comments.article: Even my Lions would have known to run the ball in the same situation. Especially with a back like Lynch! Hell, they'd probably give Stafford a shot at the QB sneak before trying an inside slant.
comments.subject: That Call

comments.article:
You've undoubtedly heard the joke (I hope you don't find it inappropriate):

Why was Pete Carroll asked leave Seattle and become a highly paid consultant to the Vatican?

Because he is the only person in the world who could get 100 million people to stand up at one time and scream "Jesus Christ" at their television sets.
comments.subject: Re: That Call

comments.article: Glad to see you're a Lebowski fan!
comments.subject: Abide

comments.article: Thank you for the new chapter! but why some parts of the text are underlined?
comments.subject: underlined parts

comments.article: Ah, you sweet summer child... underlining is how one indicates italics in a manuscript.  In the book, those passages will be italicized.
comments.subject: Re: underlined parts

comments.article: Just watched the lunar eclipse over the weekend and it got me thinking about whether we'd ever see one in the ASOIAF universe?
comments.subject: Eclipse?

comments.article: I still think that releasing Hodor sample chapter would be more fitting considering the date...

Hi George,

I have to say, this is by far my favourite chapter you've released. For years I've been looking forward to the initial conversations between Alayne and Harry :)

I have a distinct feeling that there is going to be a real shift in her situation at the Vale ;)
comments.subject: Welcome back

comments.article:
Mr Martin, is the Song of Ice and Fire an actual song that exists in Westeros? If so, will we ever hear it? This is being discussed on the forums.

Thanks in advance! :)

(Also, sorry if you got this comment several times. This is my first time using LJ and I had trouble doing it right)
comments.subject: ASOIAF question

comments.article:
Dear Mr. Martin, your books have helped me through very very stressful and hard situations in my life. Especially relation between Sandor Clegane and Sansa Stark. I ship them so hard! I hope they will meet again. I don't know why but I think it says that there is a hope even for ugly and poor souls. That even they can find somebody who will take care of them.

This "Alayne" chapter gives me a lot of hope about this (yeah, I know it sounds weird, but there is one theory... ;))

Anyway, have a good day:)

Too soon George, too soon. It still stings.
Here's to next year!
Winter (football season) is coming. Go Hawks!
Man that chapter was AMAZING!! Thank you! You released it on my birthday and it was an incredible birthday present haha. It was also my only birthday present :p
comments.subject: Alayne chapter

comments.article: The Entertainment Weekly article says that it's important to you that you release WINDS before Season 6, but did you *actually* say that you expect an early 2016 release is that just for headlines?

I was in Seattle almost three years ago for my cousins wedding (hehe). Did you get a chance to go to the Seattle Pike Place Market while there? Great attraction! Seattle is an amazing city really want to go back.
comments.subject: Seattle

comments.article: Not this trip, but I have been to Pike Place many times before.
comments.subject: Re: Seattle

comments.article: In which part of Westeros do you enjoy inventing food dishes the most? Or what part of Westeros could you see yourself enjoying the food the best? I'd probably settle with Dorne or Braavos (technically Essos) for myself
comments.subject: Lemon cakes

comments.article:
Your presence at Norwescon kept me and my stuff very busy on Thursday with a pre-reg line out the door into the parking lot.

Thank you! I like being that busy
comments.subject: Thanks!

comments.article: When you write that you're going to say a lot more about the Hugo awards, are you talking about the recent attempts to troll the award and influence the vote? I just read Arthur Chu's article in Salon about it. He makes an interesting two-fold argument: that the Hugo Awards are being trolled by right-wing reactionaries, and that this trolling is evidence for seeing internet democracy as flawed without serious safeguards. Anyways, when I read it, I hoped you would weigh in, so I was happy that when I went straight to this forum, I saw some hints that you'll say more. Cheers!
comments.subject: Hugo awards

comments.article:
Yes, I will weigh in, but not in this topic.

Probably a series of posts. There are a lot of points to make.
comments.subject: Re: Hugo awards

comments.article: I am super pleased you enjoyed our show. It was super fun & I have to say your my favorite muse! Thank you for your time & kindness.... still loving your big warm smile, swear it made it warmer here! Thank you a million times more for all you do sir!
comments.subject: Burlesque

comments.article:
George, something I've been wondering ever since I attended your Thursday signing at Norwescon. I brought in a poster map of Westeros and Essos, and after you signed it you unrolled it and scanned for something, then handed it back. I wanted to ask what you were looking for at the time, but didn't want to hold up the long line behind me. Do you remember what you were looking for?

Thank you for coming to our small con, I enjoyed your reading of the new 'Alayne' chapter immensity.

I was looking to see whether the geography was from the show or the books. HBO's world is somewhat different than my own. Westeros is more or less the same, but their version of western Essos is more compact, and the far east is completely different (HBO based theirs on an earlier version of my own master maps).

The definitive maps, for me, are those in LANDS OF ICE AND FIRE.

You get your Reddit Fantasy Stabby award for Rogues? Gardner's arrived - just checking in.

Much less drama in this fan-voted award. ;)
comments.subject: Rogues Award

comments.article:
I did. And I love it.

Thanks for reminding me. I need to post a picture.
comments.subject: Re: Rogues Award

comments.article:
Thank you for sharing yourself and your work at Norwescon! Your delivery of Alayne made the chapter much more humorous than when I read it myself earlier in the week. I'm excited to see where her arc goes. Your autograph is also very much appreciated (my coffee table now has a more interesting conversation starter).

I'm curious, what was the most interesting item presented for signature during the convention? I heard of an old comic that Stan Lee may have signed the weekend prior.

Regarding the Seahawks, I think a lot of us are still recovering from the pain of that loss. My heart sank the moment I realized they weren't going to hand Beast Mode the ball. Can't wait for next season, though!
comments.subject: Norwescon (and an aside about the Seahawks)

comments.article: I'm not surprised the Alayne chapter was so well received! It was a great chapter, and Sansa is such a great character (easily my favourite), so I'm glad you're receiving so much positive feedback. I'm looking forward to seeing where her story goes in TWOW! (no matter when it is released - I don't mean in any way to be presumptuous about your writing process. I know it will be great, and that's what matters most to me.)
comments.subject: Alayne Chapter

comments.article: This chapter is further proof of why I don't care how long the books take. The process works and it works fantastically. Amazingly honestly. I'd rather buy the best book. This chapter is far and away one of my favorites and this is coming from a guy who had previously been less interested in the Sansa storyline. This may be one of the top 10 chapters to date.
comments.subject: Yay!

comments.article: I wasn't at Norwescon (I wish!) but I read the chapter online. I wasn't expecting to see another chapter from WINDS until I had the book in my hands. So, thank you! A very nice surprise! :D

When you bought the bowling alley, I thought this was why: "GRRM is trying to recreate The Big Lebowski....by using Tyrion as the Dude, The Hound as Walter, Podrick as Donny, Tywin as the "Big" Lebowski, Cersei as Maude, Shae as Bunny Lebowski, Mace as Brandt (PSH's role), GRRM as the narrator, and Littlefinger as Jesus Quintana"
comments.subject: The Big Lebowski

comments.article:
Good Ser, thank you for that chapter. That is my favorite Sansa chapter ever.
Until this point I have not been a big fan of her, but she seems to have grown up and gotten her head out of the clouds. I can see her becoming a true force in Westeros in the future.
comments.subject: Alayne
